result.execSummary:
The defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (-pecified Harm Did Not Occur, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child -pecified Harm Did Not Occur, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child -Specified Harm Did Not Occur, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: counts 2 and 3.  Huber release privileges.

Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 8/12/2022.
Probation review hearing in Branch 23 on November 11, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court set restitution at zero.

Complete parenting classes.
Contact with J.Q., L.Q. AND  J.Q. under the discretion of DMCPS.
Cooperate with CHIPS order in cases 2022JC139, 2022JC140 and 2022JC141.
Write a letter of apology to J.Q., L.Q. and J.Q.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing set for 11/11/22 at 1:30 pm. Per filing of the agent, defendant is in compliance and a review hearing is not needed. Probation review hearing is cancelled. Agent to contact the court if a further review is needed.

Defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Counts 1, 2, and 3: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement made by T. B.

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Counts 2 and 3, with Huber release privileges, with credit for 4 days served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 months.

As to Count 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Counts 1 and 3, with Huber release privileges, with credit for 0 days served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 months.

As to Count 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2, with Huber release privileges, with credit for 0 days served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Court set restitution at zero.
- As to Counts 1, 2, and 3: Serve 30 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Contact with JQ, LQ, and JQ under the discretion of DMCPS.
- Cooperate with CHIPS order in cases 2022JC139, 2022JC140, and 2022JC141.
- Write a letter of apology to JQ, LQ, and JQ.
- No contact with firearms.
- Obtain/maintain employment and or education.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 08/12/2022.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 29.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  
Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Romenesko has received discovery and an offer and would like time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case heard by Judge Rosa, Branch 35 on behalf of Judge Kiefer, Branch 29:
 Defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear this case. Case spun to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Parties notified.

Defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel is in trial in another Court and requests an adjournment. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed, CPAU No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LQP (DOB 1/2/14); JQP (DOB 5/16/15); JQ (DOB 3/11/17); LP (DOB 7/27/21)
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Shywonda Latrice A Qualls in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shywonda Latrice A Qualls appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
